universum.studios.android.recycler.helper

Class ItemDragHelper.Interactor

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.support.v7.widget.helper.ItemTouchHelper.Callback
      • universum.studios.android.recycler.helper.RecyclerViewItemHelper.ItemInteractor
        • universum.studios.android.recycler.helper.ItemDragHelper.Interactor
  • Enclosing class:
    ItemDragHelper

    public static final class ItemDragHelper.Interactor
extends RecyclerViewItemHelper.ItemInteractor
    A ItemInteractor implementation used by ItemDragHelper to handle drag gesture related callbacks and to delegate drag events to the view holder that is being dragged and also to it parent adapter in order to properly move dragged items in the adapter's data set.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class android.support.v7.widget.helper.ItemTouchHelper.Callback

        DEFAULT_DRAG_ANIMATION_DURATION, DEFAULT_SWIPE_ANIMATION_DURATION

    • Method Detail

      • setLongPressDragEnabled

        public void setLongPressDragEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Sets a boolean flag indicating whether the drag should be started whenever an item view is long pressed or not.

        If disabled, a drag for a particular view holder needs to be started via ItemTouchHelper.startDrag(RecyclerView.ViewHolder) manually.

        Default value: true

        Parameters:
        enabled - True to enable automatic drag on long press, false to disable it.
        See Also:
        isLongPressDragEnabled()

      • isLongPressDragEnabled

        public boolean isLongPressDragEnabled()
        Overrides:
        isLongPressDragEnabled in class ItemTouchHelper.Callback

      • setDragThreshold

        public void setDragThreshold(float threshold)
        Sets a fraction that the user should move the holder's View to be considered as it is dragged.

        Default value: ItemDragHelper.MOVE_THRESHOLD

        Parameters:
        threshold - The desired threshold from the range [0.0, 1.0].
        See Also:
        getDragThreshold(), getMoveThreshold(RecyclerView.ViewHolder), getMoveThreshold(RecyclerView.ViewHolder)

      • getDragThreshold

        public float getDragThreshold()
        Returns the fraction that the user should move the holder's View to be considered as it is dragged.
        Returns:
        The drag threshold from the range [0.0, 1.0].
        See Also:
        setDragThreshold(float)

      • canAttachAdapter

        protected boolean canAttachAdapter(@NonNull
                                   RecyclerView.Adapter adapter)
        Description copied from class: RecyclerViewItemHelper.ItemInteractor
        Called by the parent helper to check if the given adapter may be attached to this interactor instance.

        If this method returns true, RecyclerViewItemHelper.ItemInteractor.onAdapterAttached(RecyclerView.Adapter) will follow. If this interactor has attached any previous adapter, such adapter will be detached via RecyclerViewItemHelper.ItemInteractor.onAdapterDetached(RecyclerView.Adapter) before the new one is attached.

        Specified by:
        canAttachAdapter in class RecyclerViewItemHelper.ItemInteractor
        Parameters:
        adapter - The adapter to be checked if it may be attached.
        Returns:
        True if the parent helper may attach the adapter to this interactor, false otherwise.

      • onAdapterAttached

        protected void onAdapterAttached(@NonNull
                                 RecyclerView.Adapter adapter)
        Description copied from class: RecyclerViewItemHelper.ItemInteractor
        Invoked whenever a new adapter is attached to this interactor instance.

        This method is called as result of call to RecyclerViewItemHelper.attachToRecyclerView(RecyclerView) for the parent helper.

        Overrides:
        onAdapterAttached in class RecyclerViewItemHelper.ItemInteractor
        Parameters:
        adapter - The adapter of the associated RecyclerView to which is the parent helper attached.
        See Also:
        RecyclerViewItemHelper.ItemInteractor.onAdapterDetached(RecyclerView.Adapter)

        protected void onAdapterDetached(@NonNull

        Description copied from class: RecyclerViewItemHelper.ItemInteractor
        Invoked before a new adapter is attached to this interactor instance if there is already previous adapter attached.
        Overrides:

        Parameters:
